text: You are caught in a trap of sleepless nights, your inner voice mocking you on mistakes you made long ago. Each effort you make feels like mental torment.

Lying on your back, your body relaxes, until you spy a strange cloud overhead. Your mind twists the visage of the distant cloud into a shape that angers you, forming the face of a man who wronged you countless years ago. Even your moments of relaxation bring you suffering.\\n
A routine sets in, as every day blurs with the last. Why bother putting in effort, when activity can bring pain? You cannot make regrets if you never made attempts to begin with, after all.

You have found your own methods of happiness, and finally begin to enjoy uninterrupted sleep. The systems of government appear to be running well enough without your supervision, so why bother interfering?

The spirits that haunt your past have been put to rest, and the whispers of self doubt have been silenced. The world may be a cruel, harsh place, but your mind is a luxurious and peaceful palace you can freely escape to.
[[b]]Languor[[/b]] can be increased by general increase, killing Sun members, and marrying Lady Wu.
[[b]]Languor[[/b]] can be decreased by doing almost anything, battles, war, and more.

So hung up are you on missed opportunities in decades past, you cannot help but dither and languish about. Being stuck in a rut of complacent idleness can be like being caught in a deadly whirlpool, almost impossible to escape from.
• Langour is increased by general increase, killing Sun members, and marrying Lady Wu.
• Langour is drained by many actions you do, from wars, buildings, and more.
• Low Langour reduces all of your stats.
